case_vignette: A 68-YEAR-OLD WHITE MAN PRESENTS WITH 4 WEEKS OF PROGRESSIVELY WORSENING THICKENING OF THE SKIN AND PLAQUES ON THE BILATERAL NIPPLE AND AREOLA. HE HAS NO PERSONAL OR FAMILY HISTORY OF WARTS OR EPIDERMAL NEVI AND HAS NOT HAD HORMONAL THERAPY. ON EXAMINATION, HE HAS HYPERPIGMENTED, VERRUCOUS PLAQUES BILATERALLY, WITH NO ASSOCIATED ERYTHEMA OR LYMPHADENOPATHY. SKIN BIOPSY SHOWS HYPERKERATOSIS WITH PAPILLOMATOSIS. CORTICOSTEROID TREATMENT FAILED, BUT THERE WAS SOME MINOR IMPROVEMENT WITH CALCIPOTRIOL AFTER SEVERAL WEEKS OF USE.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing progressively worsening thickening of the skin and plaques on both nipples and areolas for the past four weeks.
Have you noticed any changes in the color of the affected areas, or are there any other associated symptoms like itching or discharge?
Yes, the affected areas have become darker, but there's no itching or discharge.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin conditions, breast cancer, or other cancers?
No, I have no personal or family history of warts, skin conditions, or any hormonal therapies.
Do you have any other skin changes or general symptoms elsewhere on the body?
No, I don't have any other skin changes or general symptoms elsewhere on the body.
Final Diagnosis: Paget's Disease of the Breast

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
Hello! I have been experiencing progressively worsening thickening of the skin and plaques on both sides of my nipple and areola for the past 4 weeks.
Have you noticed any changes in color or texture of these plaques?
Yes, the plaques have become hyperpigmented and verrucous in texture.
Do you have any other symptoms such as nipple discharge or pain?
No, I don't have any nipple discharge or pain.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin cancer or breast cancer?
No, I do not have any personal or family history of warts, epidermal nevi, skin cancer, or breast cancer.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for these symptoms yet?
Yes, I tried corticosteroid treatment which failed, but there was some minor improvement with calcipotriol after several weeks of use.
Final Diagnosis: Mammary Paget's Disease.

trial_1.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Paget's disease of the breast

The plaques have turned hyperpigmented and verrucous in texture. The patient reports no nipple discharge or pain. Additionally, the patient has no personal or family history of warts, epidermal nevi, skin cancer, or breast cancer. Regarding treatment, the patient used corticosteroids without success, though noted minor improvements with calcipotriol after several weeks of application.
